snippet: Aries Merritt of the United States set a world record of 12.80 seconds in the 110-meter hurdles Friday, upstaging Usain Bolt’s routine 100-meter victory in the final Diamond League meet of the season in Brussels.
abstract: American hurdler Aries Merritt sets a world record of 12.80 seconds in the 110-meters, upstaging Usain Bolt’s routine 100-meter victory in the final Diamond League meet of the season in Brussels.
lead_paragraph: Aries Merritt of the United States set a world record of 12.80 seconds in the 110-meter hurdles Friday, upstaging Usain Bolt’s routine 100-meter victory in the final Diamond League meet of the season in Brussels.
